title: Chi Draconis
text:
Chi Draconis (χ Dra, χ Draconis, Chi Draconis) is a <a href="star">star</a> system in the <a href="constellation">constellation</a> <a href="Draco%20%28constellation%29">Draco</a>.
Description.
The first companion is a yellow-white (class F) fourth-magnitude star with a mass approximately equal to that of the <a href="sun">sun</a>, but it is nearly twice as luminous. The second companion is an orange (class K) sixth-magnitude star, that is less massive and of lesser <a href="luminosity">luminosity</a> than the sun. In 1898 this system was reported to be a <a href="spectroscopic%20binary">spectroscopic binary</a> system, with an orbital period of 280.55 days. The two stars have an average separation of nearly an <a href="astronomical%20unit">astronomical unit</a>, which would disrupt the orbit of any Earth-like planet that was close enough to the primary to support liquid water. The two stars have less than half the abundance of heavy elements as the <a href="Sun">Sun</a> and are approximately a billion years older. Separations between the two stars have been measured and the difference in brightness between the two stars is 2.12 magnitudes at 700 <a href="Nanometre">nm</a>.
